answer.title: Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
answer.description: Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table This design uses a 2level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this:row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]However this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on "COUNTRY" is to insertrows[0]["COUNTRY"]into the expression.The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array is the 0based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first level inner table etc.).
answer.OB: The report designer should figure out the correct index number by looking at the nesting levels of all tables.
answer.EB: The report designer should figure out the correct index number by looking at the nesting levels of all tables.
answer.SR: Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). To do this double click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression. Click on "Available Data Sets", choose data set "offices", then double click on column "COUNTRY".

answer.title: Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
answer.description: Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
answer.OB: answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop upmenu in the editor it takes15 seconds to replace the contents of the windowwith the original.
answer.EB: This seems odd, since reverting the file contents ought notto be more than closing and reopening the file.
answer.SR: This is a regression introduced in 3.1.0. This is fixed in 3.1.1. The fix is a regression test for the revert functionality. This is not a bug, but a regression test for a bug.

answer.title: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection
answer.description: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have thedialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.
answer.OB: If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry usingthe mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. Standard Combos won'tdo this.Because of this you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entryusing the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo.
answer.EB: It shouldfire a selection instead.Default selection means something was selected and you should go and dosomething. The typical reaction is to process the selection and dismiss the dialog.A combo shouldn't fire default selection from just selecting an entry in thedropdown. Hittingenter from the text field should be treated as default selection.
answer.SR: 1. Open the combo. 2. Drop down the combo list using the mouse. 3. Select an entry using the mouse. 4. The combo should not fire defaultSelection. 5. The combo should not dismiss the dialog.

answer.title: Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog
answer.description: Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog It makes this dialog almost unusable since we can't determine thecorrect file extension to append to the file name.
answer.OB: There's no way to get the file extension that the user selected from theFileDialog. We need an api for the filedialog to return the "Save as type" field that the user selected in theFileDialog.Athough we are using this dialog in our own product, this problem can beillustrated when you export to a jar file.
answer.EB: The user should be able to select the file type, and we need to know the file type selected by the user.
answer.SR: To reproduce the problem, click File, Save As, and select the file type.

answer.title: Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first
answer.OB: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows.

answer.SR: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows.
